content.question: Which of the following is true of the slave system in eighteenth-century British North America?

choices.label: The slave system was legal only in the southern colonies.
Indentured servants increasingly replaced slaves in the southern colonies.
Slaveowners gained increased legal power over their slaves.
Most slaves worked on cotton plantations.
All the southern colonies passed laws against freeing slaves.

content.answer: Slaveowners gained increased legal power over their slaves.

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
